contentrichtext.text: {{merge to|St Martin's, Isles of Scilly|Eastern Isles|discuss=Talk:English Island, Isles of Scilly|date=April 2012}} {{Unreferenced|date=January 2010}} {{Infobox UK feature |official_name = English Island |static_image_name = |static_image_caption = |shire_county/state = Isles of Scilly |country = England |nation = UK |map_name = United Kingdom Isles of Scilly |os_grid_reference = SV939150 |latitude = 49.9567 |longitude = -6.2689 }} '''English Island''' is an uninhabited island that is part of the [[Isles of Scilly]], although it is realistically no more than a rock. It lies just of the coast of [[St Martin's, Isles of Scilly|St Martin's]] and is part of the Eastern Isles. ==See also== *[[List of islands]] *[[List of shipwrecks of the Isles of Scilly]] {{Isles of Scilly}} [[Category:Islands of the Isles of Scilly]] [[Category:Uninhabited islands of the Isles of Scilly]] {{cornwall-geo-stub}}
